column4: I'm having trouble with a hard-drive, have finally managed to boot up systemrescuecd but not sure how to go about recovering it now - any suggestions or where should I look for help? :x
what do you want to recover?
As much as I can, or at the very least my Ubuntu-wubi install so I can get my passwords and files back. :x
i'm new to ubuntu (i used several different distr.) but i think you want to backup your /home/dvvie (example) folder
whats your problem with your current ubuntu installation on your disk?
The problem isn't with the installation itself, the disk has just become unopenable, and I'm trying to recover its data somehow.
is your home directory encrypted?
It doesn't even get to the OS-selection screen, just errors out and asks me to press CtrlAltDel to reboot. And it's not encrypted as far as I know.
Thanks! I'll go try those now and see how it works. Thanks for your help!
mount for example a ubuntu-live-cd and check if you can access your hdd. if its possible, backup your /home/ folder to a different place, like a second hdd or usb-device

do you know where you installed your wubi exactly?
Hm, probably in C:\ubuntu\ I think, not sure though. And just being able to copy the file itself would be great.
read the part "How can I make a backup of my Wubi install?" https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WubiGuide/
